Package com.prc.alp.liaison.weather

Provides a demonstration capability for an ALP/Cougaar cluster to engage in a liaison with an external RETSINA InfoAgent (via the CoABS Grid) for the purpose of acquiring weather forecasts.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
ForecastConditions Describes forecasted weather conditions at a specified place and time as of a particular time when the forecast was made.
PSP_WeatherImpact An ALP/Cougaar PSP (Plan Service Provider) that provides an HTML-based GUI display of the impact of weather forecasts on planned transportation tasks.
RequirementAggregationPlugIn Builds an aggregated, correlated task to get the weather forecast for a particular location and time in response to multiple independent forecast requirements.
WConstants A convenience class for organizing all of the configurable constants and translation functions associated with ALP/Cougaar society use of weather forecast conditions supplied by external RETSINA agents.
WeatherLiaisonPlugIn Establishes a liaison with an external RETSINA weather InfoAgent to get weather forecast information in response to the publishing of aggregated forecast tasks.
WeatherRequirementPlugIn Responds to the publishing of new PREPAREFORTRANSPORT tasks by creating new weather requirement tasks.
WeatherTrigger Responds to the receipt and publishing of weather forecast information by a WeatherLiaisonPlugIn.
WeatherTrigger.Action An implementation of the TriggerAction interface that makes changes to the itineraries of PREPAREFORTRANSPORT tasks.
WeatherTrigger.Monitor An implementation of the TriggerMonitor interface that reacts to aggregated weather forecast tasks that have become stale.
WeatherTrigger.Tester A trival implementation of the TriggerTester interface that always returns true.
 

Package com.prc.alp.liaison.weather Description

Provides a demonstration capability for an ALP/Cougaar cluster to engage in a liaison with an external RETSINA InfoAgent (via the CoABS Grid) for the purpose of acquiring weather forecasts. These forecasts are then used within the cluster to alter the planned timing of itineraries in certain transportation-related tasks.

These components are designed to function when integrated within the Litton TASC ALP/Cougaar society that plans Air Expeditionary Force (AEF) logistics operations, and specifically, within the GlobalAir cluster of that society.
